body:
## Description When I run a set of tests, there are several significant differences in the UI for macOS and Linux versions of the Flutter plugin. When I run a test suite on Linux, I can right click on the test and run just the test, or right click on the group, and run just the group. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8867023/135137527-bb0b5e22-e1c0-4471-a733-8722b7c86db4.png) On macOS, it doesn't show the name of the test file (it says "``" instead), and I just get "Nothing here" when I right click. Also, on Linux, double-clicking on a test takes me to the test declaration in the editor, but on macOS, nothing happens. Could we maybe bring the macOS plugin up to par with the Linux plugin? I haven't tested Windows, but if it's different, we should probably also fix that too. ## Version info ### macOS

comment_data.body:
Actually, I'm realizing that I seem to have different versions of the Flutter plugin: I tried reinstalling on the mac, and now the version says "DEV", which I assume means I'm on a dev channel there.  I'm not sure how to get off of the dev channel...

Also, now that I tried reinstalling, `flutter doctor -v` reports "Flutter plugin can be installed from:"  with a URL, instead of a Flutter plugin version.

OK, I was able to get off of the dev channel, but I still see the same issues. I updated the version info with the newest plugin I can install, which appears to be `46.0.3` for macOS, and `60.1.4` for Linux. Perhaps the macOS plugin isn't getting properly distributed?
OK, nevermind.  IntelliJ just stopped prompting me for app updates for some reason, and my IntelliJ was out of date on my Mac. After updating everything, the UIs match. Sorry for the noise.

title: Running tests has different UI and features on macOS and Linux
